headline: Vernon Jones Staying In Georgia Governor's RaceBut Trump Wants Him To Drop Out
author: Nicholas Reimann
sentences: The Georgia governor's race is one of the most widely anticipated contests of the 2022 midterms, and the GOP primary will be a major test of the power of Trump's endorsement against an incumbent with high approval ratings among Republicans.

Topline
Former Georgia state Rep. Vernon Jones (R) indicated Wednesday he plans to remain a candidate in the state's Republican gubernatorial primary, despite former President Donald Trump reportedly offering him a deal to drop out.

According to CNN, Trump spoke with Jones at Mar-a-Lago last week and suggested he drop out, as the former president works to clear the field for former Sen. David Perdue, who Trump has endorsed, to take on incumbent Gov.

Last month's Quinnipiac poll showed Kemp holding a 70% favorability rating among Republicans, even though Trump continually attacked him after the 2020 election for not helping overturn his loss in the state.

Key Facts
Jones, who left the Democratic Party after backing Trump in 2020, tweeted: "My priority is - and has been since Day One - is to do whatever it takes to defeat Brian Kemp."
Jones and Perdue are running on a similar anti-Kemp platform, blasting the governor for not intervening to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election.
Trump reportedly told Jones he should run for Congress in either Georgia's 6th or 10th congressional districts, offering an immediate endorsement if he did so.
The Quinnipiac poll showed Abrams in a 48%-48% tie with Perdue and trailing Kemp in a potential matchup by two percentage points.
Whoever wins the race will likely take on Democrat Stacey Abrams in what's expected to be an extremely tight general election.
A Quinnipiac University survey last month found Kemp in the lead with 43% support, followed by Perdue at 36% and Jones at 10%.
Abrams lost the 2018 governor's race to Kemp by about 55,000 votes but never conceded, accusing Kemp of voter suppression.
The primary campaign has already become a high dollar, scorched-earth war of words between Perdue and Kemp.
Polls show Jones running a distant third behind Kemp and Perdue in the GOP primary.
Kemp has repeatedly denied the claim.
The GOP primary will be held May 24.
